headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c de Kock b Rabada 138 (140b 6x4 5x6 202m) SR: 98.57

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of Kohli, he's caught behind for 138! Shortish ball going down leg and he pulled, got a faint edge and QdK took it easily

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c de Villiers b Steyn 53 (52b 3x4 1x6 87m) SR: 101.92

dismissalComment.html: back of length, pulled straight to midwicket for an easy catch! A crucial fifty from Raina comes to an end because of Steyn with a shortish ball

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: so many catches flying around and now QdK has taken a stunner! Finally Rabada's short ball gets him a wicket - it was on the leg side and Dhawan pulled awkwardly and got the ball to pop up fine on the leg side. QdK took two steps before flying to his right and took it with only one hand!
that's the end of Kohli, he's caught behind for 138! Shortish ball going down leg and he pulled, got a faint edge and QdK took it easily

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh Harbhajan is bowled down the leg side! He wanted to tuck the ball to leg with the angle, and the ball deflected off his pads to the stumps. The umpires are checking for a no ball, and Rabada has overstepped here, nothing behind the line when his heel lands. Oh, hello! He's still been given out. Can't figure out the reason why that's not a no ball and the TV commentators are confused too

and the change works - Steyn has got him caught behind! There was some room, Rahane went for the shot without moving his feet much and the ball stayed a tad low to take the bottom edge and QdK took it with both hands, Steyn is pumped after a long time
back of length, pulled straight to midwicket for an easy catch! A crucial fifty from Raina comes to an end because of Steyn with a shortish ball

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: makes room for the short ball, flays it down the ground and finds mid off. Excellent over this is from Steyn

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c du Plessis b Morris 21 (19b 4x4 0x6 21m) SR: 110.52

dismissalComment.html: flicked uppishly again and this time he's given a catch to midwicket! It was angling in towards the pads, Rohit flicked and found du Plessis, who tumbled to his right for a low catch

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c de Kock b Rabada 7 (15b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 46.66

dismissalComment.html: so many catches flying around and now QdK has taken a stunner! Finally Rabada's short ball gets him a wicket - it was on the leg side and Dhawan pulled awkwardly and got the ball to pop up fine on the leg side. QdK took two steps before flying to his right and took it with only one hand!

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c de Kock b Steyn 45 (53b 4x4 0x6 79m) SR: 84.9

dismissalComment.html: and the change works - Steyn has got him caught behind! There was some room, Rahane went for the shot without moving his feet much and the ball stayed a tad low to take the bottom edge and QdK took it with both hands, Steyn is pumped after a long time

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c de Villiers b Steyn 53 (52b 3x4 1x6 87m) SR: 101.92

dismissalText.commentary: Harbhajan Singh b Rabada 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh Harbhajan is bowled down the leg side! He wanted to tuck the ball to leg with the angle, and the ball deflected off his pads to the stumps. The umpires are checking for a no ball, and Rabada has overstepped here, nothing behind the line when his heel lands. Oh, hello! He's still been given out. Can't figure out the reason why that's not a no ball and the TV commentators are confused too

dismissalComment.html: makes room for the short ball, flays it down the ground and finds mid off. Excellent over this is from Steyn

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar run out (Steyn) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: a wicket to end the innings too! Bhuvi hardly got any bat on the short ball on off stump, Steyn collected the ball and ran him out at the non-striker's end

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Dhoni b Kumar 112 (107b 10x4 2x6 128m) SR: 104.67

dismissalComment.html: he's got the big wicket, AB is caught behind off a short ball after a fighting and valiant century! The bouncer seamed in, AB went for the pull and got an edge for Dhoni to take it low in front of him. AB gets a standing ovation as he waves his bat around

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Rahane b Harbhajan Singh 43 (35b 6x4 1x6 54m) SR: 122.85

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan was on the prowl and Jinxy the Cat takes it at second slip! Nicely tossed up outside off, QdK is tempted for the drive and he goes for it too, edging the ball to slips

he's got the big wicket, AB is caught behind off a short ball after a fighting and valiant century! The bouncer seamed in, AB went for the pull and got an edge for Dhoni to take it low in front of him. AB gets a standing ovation as he waves his bat around
short ball number three gets him another wicket! It was directed towards his body and Phangiso made room to pull, but got an edge high on off to be caught by a running Axar at short third man
this was also shortish, Steyn pulled and sent it high on the leg side to be caught by Jinxy the Cat running in from deep backward square leg. Made it look easy

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan was on the prowl and Jinxy the Cat takes it at second slip! Nicely tossed up outside off, QdK is tempted for the drive and he goes for it too, edging the ball to slips

oh, that's the other one, it doesn't turn but goes the other way after pitching on off and hit him right in front of middle stump on the front foot. The players appeal, the crowd appeals and Ravi's finger goes up

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Dhawan b MM Sharma 7 (10b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: pulled to the leg side and straight to midwicket, the crowd has come alive! It was short around off, Amla got into position nicely to pull and Dhawan had to jump just a bit to catch with both hands

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Dhoni b Patel 17 (34b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: big appeal and the finger goes up! Faf barely moved his feet for the length delivery outside off, it turned away sharply as Faf poked his bat and Dhoni went up as soon as he pouched it. Faf shows his displeasure by raising his right arm and says something too. Replays show there was some noise when the ball went past the bat, Snicko also shows there was something

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller lbw b Harbhajan Singh 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: oh, that's the other one, it doesn't turn but goes the other way after pitching on off and hit him right in front of middle stump on the front foot. The players appeal, the crowd appeals and Ravi's finger goes up

headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien lbw b Mishra 22 (38b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 57.89

dismissalComment.html: another appeal - this time for lbw and the finger goes up, this time FB doesn't look happy! FB went for the sweep for the straighter ball that pitched on off, missed the ball and was hit in front of off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris run out (Rahane) 9 (18b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw, he survives that and is looking down while AB wants a run, he has his arms in the air as if saying, "why aren't you running?" Morris realises that too late and takes off but there's a direct hit at the non-striker's end. And who was the fielder at point? Jinxy the Cat!

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: the last ball is lofted over the covers by Tahir and sweeper cover cuts it in

commentPostTextItems.html: AB de Villiers: We had a great opportunity to clinch the series and the fans will be happy in Mumbai after 2-2. No, the toss didn't decide the fate, a lot of people tried to get that out of me but that's not true. It was a hard-fought game and I loved the way the boys fought till the end. It was a pretty tough wicket to play on and Virat assessed the conditions very well early on. The ball was turning quite a bit and I got a few away at the end, I worked hard and hopefully we'll take some positives to Mumbai.

MS Dhoni: As a total team we did well, bowled well and batted well. They (batsmen) need to give themselves a bit more time and that was the reason to promote Raina and after he gets going he can play the big shots. Everyone has scored runs in the series now so that's good going into the last match. Virat batted exceedingly well and after this. I think it is (short ball is a weapon in the death overs), especially the grounds are bigger and the ball gets scuffed up. It gets difficult to clear the ball from an awkward height to go for the big shots and the bowlers are the ones evolve better than the batsmen, with the fifth fielder they think it's heaven for them now. It was important that bowlers took the responsibility, so I shuffled them up and the three spinners were good. The fast bowlers also have to do their job and finish their quote of 10, or at least nine overs so I decided not to use a part-time bowler.

Kohli is the Man of the Match: The cramps are fine now and the physio told me not to take a chance because I might tear a muscle or two if I sprint or something and the fifth match is still left. It was pretty difficult because there wasn't much breeze during the day when it was hot. If AB starts cramping then you know how hard it is because he is one of the fittest people around. They were bowling in good areas and was tough to get the boundaries so we had to get the single and twos. It always feels good when you get a century and the team wins and while chasing I like it because you get a chance to finish the game. Any century in a winning cause is always special. I told him (de Villiers) in the dressing room my heart was in my mouth when he was batting, he plays unbelievable shots. He's a very modest man too, never praises himself so I'll do that for him. The credit goes to him, he fought it out.

That's all from us then, neutral fans will be loving it as the series heads to Mumbai after 2-2. Two top teams fighting it out so do join us for that, and until then enjoy the other international matches too because whichever spot you choose on the map these days, there's a match going on there. Time for me, Vishal Dikshit, to signoff, ta ta!
Vallathol: "For once, nice to see Dhoni bowl out all his bowlers without banking on part-timers. If only there was better sting in the pace battery !"
Kanav: "This series seems like a well scripted theatre act."
ANAY Loya: "Which ever team wins the toss in final match is going to win the series."

9.26pm So that makes it 2-2 and the series is alive. India did several things right today after winning the toss - Kohli's fluent and quick hundred kept them on course throughout the innings for a big total. Rahane worked at No. 4 and Raina chipped in with a fifty too. 300 was going to be tough on this turning track but AB tried whatever he could to take his team close. He particularly targeted the leg side, played all kind of shots that would get you runs but didn't get enough support from the middle order as the spinners strangled SA. Harbhajan bowled beautifully in his first spell of six overs with turn, flight, and dip to beat the batsmen often.

Harbhajan: "I enjoy it whenever i get the opportunity to play and bowl and really enjoying the series. I think I've done that a lot (aggressive celebrations) so I'm just keeping my energy. We bowled really well, especially the spinners, and the seamers came back strongly towards the end."

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: that was another run out chance missed, by Axar, as Tahir worked the ball to midwicket and Rabada wa sway out the crease but Axar missed at the bowler's end
tries a yorker and it's a low full toss on off stump, Rabada guides it to point for one
slow and wide outside off, Rabada pulls to leg and misses
slower ball at 105.8kph around middle and leg, Tahir waits and waits and then helps it to leg awkwardly for one

commentPreTextItems.html: Mohit for the last over now, around the wicket

commentTextItems.html: short ball angled in and he manages to get some bat while pulling it
134kph, bouncer again and Tahir swings and misses

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short ball again and it's swatted to deep square leg for two
slow and full this time at 108kph, Tahir swings and misses
this bouncer doesn't go over his head as Tahir leaves the ball outside off
good length ball on the stumps and he defends on the leg side
short again, and that's too short this time and is called a wide
angles the bouncer in dangerously at 137kph and Tahir sways out of the line just in time
another slower ball outside off, Rabada doesn't get close to the body while pulling and misses again

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a lot of confusion, the ball deflects off the pads to point and he's called for one by Rabada so Tahir goes out of the crease but then Rabada changes his mind and Rahane misses a direct hit from point to concede an overthrow
another slower ball outside off - 120kph - he slaps it over the mid on region for one
slower bouncer outside off deceives Rabada as he looks to pull and misses
it's full and wide and Rabada smokes that after opening up through the covers! Raina at cover got a hand to it but it went for four nevertheless
short of length ball on the body, pulled to fine leg for one to keep strike

commentPostTextItems.html: Two wickets and five runs from the over

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c de Kock b Rabada 7 (15b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 46.66

dismissalComment.html: so many catches flying around and now QdK has taken a stunner! Finally Rabada's short ball gets him a wicket - it was on the leg side and Dhawan pulled awkwardly and got the ball to pop up fine on the leg side. QdK took two steps before flying to his right and took it with only one hand!

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c de Kock b Steyn 45 (53b 4x4 0x6 79m) SR: 84.9

dismissalComment.html: and the change works - Steyn has got him caught behind! There was some room, Rahane went for the shot without moving his feet much and the ball stayed a tad low to take the bottom edge and QdK took it with both hands, Steyn is pumped after a long time

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c de Villiers b Steyn 53 (52b 3x4 1x6 87m) SR: 101.92

dismissalComment.html: back of length, pulled straight to midwicket for an easy catch! A crucial fifty from Raina comes to an end because of Steyn with a shortish ball

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c de Kock b Rabada 138 (140b 6x4 5x6 202m) SR: 98.57

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of Kohli, he's caught behind for 138! Shortish ball going down leg and he pulled, got a faint edge and QdK took it easily

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harbhajan Singh b Rabada 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh Harbhajan is bowled down the leg side! He wanted to tuck the ball to leg with the angle, and the ball deflected off his pads to the stumps. The umpires are checking for a no ball, and Rabada has overstepped here, nothing behind the line when his heel lands. Oh, hello! He's still been given out. Can't figure out the reason why that's not a no ball and the TV commentators are confused too

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c de Villiers b Steyn 15 (16b 1x4 0x6 28m) SR: 93.75

dismissalComment.html: makes room for the short ball, flays it down the ground and finds mid off. Excellent over this is from Steyn

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar run out (Steyn) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: a wicket to end the innings too! Bhuvi hardly got any bat on the short ball on off stump, Steyn collected the ball and ran him out at the non-striker's end

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Rahane b Harbhajan Singh 43 (35b 6x4 1x6 54m) SR: 122.85

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan was on the prowl and Jinxy the Cat takes it at second slip! Nicely tossed up outside off, QdK is tempted for the drive and he goes for it too, edging the ball to slips

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Dhawan b MM Sharma 7 (10b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: pulled to the leg side and straight to midwicket, the crowd has come alive! It was short around off, Amla got into position nicely to pull and Dhawan had to jump just a bit to catch with both hands

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Dhoni b Patel 17 (34b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: big appeal and the finger goes up! Faf barely moved his feet for the length delivery outside off, it turned away sharply as Faf poked his bat and Dhoni went up as soon as he pouched it. Faf shows his displeasure by raising his right arm and says something too. Replays show there was some noise when the ball went past the bat, Snicko also shows there was something

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Dhoni b Kumar 112 (107b 10x4 2x6 128m) SR: 104.67

dismissalComment.html: he's got the big wicket, AB is caught behind off a short ball after a fighting and valiant century! The bouncer seamed in, AB went for the pull and got an edge for Dhoni to take it low in front of him. AB gets a standing ovation as he waves his bat around

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller lbw b Harbhajan Singh 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: oh, that's the other one, it doesn't turn but goes the other way after pitching on off and hit him right in front of middle stump on the front foot. The players appeal, the crowd appeals and Ravi's finger goes up

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien lbw b Mishra 22 (38b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 57.89

dismissalComment.html: another appeal - this time for lbw and the finger goes up, this time FB doesn't look happy! FB went for the sweep for the straighter ball that pitched on off, missed the ball and was hit in front of off stump

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris run out (Rahane) 9 (18b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw, he survives that and is looking down while AB wants a run, he has his arms in the air as if saying, "why aren't you running?" Morris realises that too late and takes off but there's a direct hit at the non-striker's end. And who was the fielder at point? Jinxy the Cat!

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Aaron Phangiso c Patel b Kumar 20 (22b 1x4 0x6 33m) SR: 90.9

dismissalComment.html: short ball number three gets him another wicket! It was directed towards his body and Phangiso made room to pull, but got an edge high on off to be caught by a running Axar at short third man

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn c Rahane b Kumar 6 (7b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: this was also shortish, Steyn pulled and sent it high on the leg side to be caught by Jinxy the Cat running in from deep backward square leg. Made it look easy

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada not out 8 (9b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 88.88
Imran Tahir not out 4 (10b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: he's got the big wicket, AB is caught behind off a short ball after a fighting and valiant century! The bouncer seamed in, AB went for the pull and got an edge for Dhoni to take it low in front of him. AB gets a standing ovation as he waves his bat around
short ball number three gets him another wicket! It was directed towards his body and Phangiso made room to pull, but got an edge high on off to be caught by a running Axar at short third man
this was also shortish, Steyn pulled and sent it high on the leg side to be caught by Jinxy the Cat running in from deep backward square leg. Made it look easy

notes: India innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 43 runs, 2 wickets)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 187 runs, 1 wicket)
India: 50 runs in 11.4 overs (70 balls), Extras 2
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 48 balls (V Kohli 32, AM Rahane 17, Ex 1)
Drinks: India - 86/2 in 16.0 overs (V Kohli 39, AM Rahane 17)
India: 100 runs in 18.6 overs (114 balls), Extras 2
V Kohli: 50 off 51 balls (2 x 4, 2 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 102 balls (V Kohli 55, AM Rahane 43, Ex 2)
India: 150 runs in 28.4 overs (172 balls), Extras 4
Drinks: India - 169/3 in 32.0 overs (V Kohli 83, SK Raina 8)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 52 balls (V Kohli 31, SK Raina 16, Ex 5)
India: 200 runs in 36.5 overs (221 balls), Extras 9
V Kohli: 100 off 112 balls (4 x 4, 3 x 6)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 69 runs, 5 wickets)
4th Wicket: 100 runs in 89 balls (V Kohli 53, SK Raina 40, Ex 7)
India: 250 runs in 42.3 overs (255 balls), Extras 12
SK Raina: 50 off 48 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
Innings Break: India - 299/8 in 50.0 overs (AR Patel 4)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 63 runs, 1 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 7.4 overs (48 balls), Extras 6
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 137 runs, 5 wickets)
Drinks: South Africa - 73/2 in 13.5 overs (F du Plessis 13, AB de Villiers 4)
South Africa: 100 runs in 20.6 overs (128 balls), Extras 6
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 69 balls (AB de Villiers 33, F Behardien 17, Ex 0)
South Africa: 150 runs in 32.3 overs (197 balls), Extras 6
AB de Villiers: 50 off 67 balls (5 x 4)
Drinks: South Africa - 166/5 in 34.0 overs (AB de Villiers 65, CH Morris 0)
South Africa: 200 runs in 39.5 overs (241 balls), Extras 8
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 64 runs, 3 wickets)
AB de Villiers: 100 off 98 balls (10 x 4, 2 x 6)
South Africa: 250 runs in 46.2 overs (280 balls), Extras 8

milestones.description: de Villiers has scored 22 hundreds in ODIs, the most for SA breaking Hashim Amla's record

stories.title: India v South Africa, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 4th ODI, Chennai
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: India v South Africa 2015-16
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the fourth ODI, India v South Africa, 2015-16

stories.title: Du Plessis fined for showing dissent after dismissal
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai
stories.seoTitle: Du Plessis fined for showing dissent after dismissal
stories.summary: South Africa batsman Faf du Plessis has been fined 15% of his match fee for showing dissent at an umpire's decision during the fourth ODI against India in Chennai

image.caption: MS Dhoni celebrates after taking catch to dismiss Faf du Plessis
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla walks back after being dismissed for 7, India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai, October 22, 2015

stories.title: Domingo not worried over slow-pitch struggles
stories.subTitle: India v SA, 4th ODI, Chennai
stories.seoTitle: Russell Domingo not worried over slow-pitch struggles
stories.summary: South Africa coach Russell Domingo is not unduly worried about his batsmen's aptitude on turning pitches despite four of the top six batsmen falling to spin in Chennai

image.longCaption: Ajinkya Rahane takes a catch at slip to dismiss Quinton de Kock , India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai, October 22, 2015

stories.title: Dhoni hails Kohli's mindset, approach in the heat
stories.subTitle: India v SA, 4th ODI, Chennai
stories.seoTitle: MS Dhoni hails Kohli's mindset, approach in the heat
stories.summary: Virat Kohli's 23rd ODI century was the cornerstone of India's series levelling victory in Chennai and it was also a sign of his evolution as a batsman according to MS Dhoni

image.caption: Virat Kohli acknowledges the crowd after getting to fifty
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli acknowledges the crowd after getting to fifty, India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai, October 22, 2015

stories.title: New rules have made slogging difficult - Dhoni
stories.subTitle: India v SA, 4th ODI, Chennai
stories.seoTitle: New rules have made slogging difficult - Dhoni
stories.summary: India's captain MS Dhoni believes that the presence of an extra fielder outside the ring during the slog overs has made it "difficult" for batsmen to find the "big shots"

stories.title: India target death-overs boost to stay alive

videos.seoTitle: Agarkar: SA are struggling against India's spin
videos.summary: Ajit Agarkar and Raunak Kapoor discuss India's series-leveling win against South Africa, in Chennai

recentReportStory.title: India spin out South Africa after Kohli's 138
recentReportStory.subTitle: India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai
recentReportStory.seoTitle: India spin out South Africa after Virat Kohli's 138
recentReportStory.summary: Virat Kohli scored his first ODI century against South Africa to anchor an authoritative Indian batting performance, before their spinners did the rest

image.caption: Virat Kohli celebrates his hundred
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli celebrates his hundred, India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai, October 22, 2015

recentReportStory.credit: Firdose Moonda is ESPNcricinfo's South Africa correspondent

recentPreviewStory.title: India target death-overs boost to stay alive
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: India v South Africa, 4th ODI, Chennai
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: India target death-overs boost to stay alive
recentPreviewStory.summary: India will look to lift themselves to force the series into a decider in Mumbai while South Africa will be keen to wrap up the series and set the tone for the Tests

image.caption: MS Dhoni takes a break during a training session
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni takes a break during a training session, Rajkot, October 17, 2015

recentPreviewStory.credit: Firdose Moonda is ESPNcricinfo's South Africa correspondent
